titles.title: Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-45, by Mr. Dreier.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 14.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.

During the course of debate, Mr. Delay demanded that certain words of Mr. Miller of California be taken down and reported to the House. The words in question were reported to the House and were deemed to be in order.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213 - 196 (Roll no. 74).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/8/1997--Introduced. Makes it in order at any time on April 9 or 10, 1997, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules.
